title: Article and photograph on Juneteenth - evidence

content.question: Which of the following statements is best supported by the decorated carriage and elaborate dress of the individuals presented in Source 2?

choices.label: African Americans’ celebration of Juneteenth showcased the high value they placed on their newly found freedom and the joy and validation they experienced among members of their own community.

African Americans’ celebrations of Juneteenth and other Freedom Days were primarily focused on honoring their ancestors and communal leaders who gave their lives in the struggle to end slavery in the United States.
The end of slavery created deep divisions among African Americans based on economic inequalities within their communities.
African American women were more frequently permitted to participate in celebrations of Freedom Days, as African American men were expected to work.

content.answer: African Americans’ celebration of Juneteenth showcased the high value they placed on their newly found freedom and the joy and validation they experienced among members of their own community.
